body:
When doing `helm dependency build` with the Helm v3 CLI on a chart using the Helm `v1` API, the following error occurs:

```
┌─[/tmp/test-chart]
└─▪ helm dependency build
Error: Chart.lock is out of sync with Chart.yaml
```

#### Expected Behaviour
Based on the [Helm v2 to v3 FAQ](https://v3.helm.sh/docs/faq/#consolidation-of-requirements-yaml-into-chart-yaml), Helm v3 should behave the same as Helm v2 with a chart using the Helm `v1` API.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a new chart using the Helm v2 CLI

```
┌─[/tmp]
└─▪ helm2 create test-chart
Creating test-chart
```

2. Add a `requirements.yaml` to the chart and add one or more dependencies. I used the following:

```yaml
dependencies:
- name: postgresql
  version: 6.5.5
  repository: https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com/
  condition: postgresql.enabled
```

3. Run `dependency build` using the Helm v2 and v3 CLI, observing the different outputs.
Helm v2
```
┌─[/tmp/test-chart]
└─▪ helm2 dependency build
Hang tight while we grab the latest from your chart repositories...
...Unable to get an update from the "local" chart repository (http://127.0.0.1:8879/charts):
	Get http://127.0.0.1:8879/charts/index.yaml: dial tcp 127.0.0.1:8879: connect: connection refused
...Successfully got an update from the "stable" chart repository
Update Complete.
Saving 1 charts
Downloading postgresql from repo https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com/
Deleting outdated charts
```
Helm v3
```
┌─[/tmp/test-chart]
└─▪ helm dependency build
Error: Chart.lock is out of sync with Chart.yaml
```

### CLI Versions

```
└─▪ helm2 version
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.16.1", GitCommit:"bbdfe5e7803a12bbdf97e94cd847859890cf4050", GitTreeState:"clean"}
└─▪ helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0", GitCommit:"e29ce2a54e96cd02ccfce88bee4f58bb6e2a28b6", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.4"}
```

title: Lock digest differs when performing dependency build on chart in Helm 2 and then Helm 3
